page.title: 06FARMING ON THE VALLEY FLOOR
page.content: The{Trent Valley}has{variable soils} from sandy to clay,sometimes in the same field,because of the way the local nature of the currents of the post ice-age slowing waters affected the deposition of the suspended mater- ials.Skilful management means that good crops are grown.{Oil seed rape} seems now to predominate but there is still plenty of{wheat}and{barley.Sugar { beet}and a few{potatoes}are grown. There are some fields of cultivated grass for hay and,fortunately,there are a few long standing{meadows}where {cowslips}bloom.The grazing{cows} ,mainly Freisian,are for{beef.} Strangely enough,there are not many clear-cut farms - Manor Farm of 100 acres,Bleasby being an exception.Many fields are owned or worked by outsiders for themselves or on behalf of minor owners who are not farmers.
